thread.title: Making Seychelles-India Day Celebrations a success
thread.title_full: Making Seychelles-India Day Celebrations a success

author: eTN Editor
title: Making Seychelles-India Day Celebrations a success
text:
Making Seychelles-India Day Celebrations a success   
Sep 03, 2015   
The Seychelles Minister for Tourism and Culture, Alain St.Ange, has called on the Seychellois Indian community to stay united to make this yearâ€™s Seychelles-India Day Celebrations successful. 
He expressed these words while meeting the members of the Seychelles-India Day committee on Thursday at the House of Culture, the National Cultural Centre in Victoria. 
The meeting was attended by the Indian High Commissioner, Sanjay Panda; Principal Secretary for Culture Benjamine Rose; Chief Executive of the National Arts Council Jimmy Savy; and the Seychelles Tourism Board CEO, Sherin Naiken. 
Minister Alain St.Ange said the Indian community of Seychelles is well recognized and respected for the important part they have played to make Seychelles what it is today. 
During the meeting, the final touches were put on the program for the three-day event which will be taking place on October 2-4. 
The opening ceremony is set to be held at the International Conference Centre on October 2, which will be followed by a cultural show. 
Activities for the three-day event will be similar to last year, but a few new elements have been added for this third Seychelles-India Day Celebrations. 
This event, which has become an annual one, will be a chance for all to get a true taste of India through the cultural activities which will be organized. 
Seychelles is a founding member of the International Coalition of Tourism Partners (ICTP) . Source: Seychelles Ministry of Tourism and Culture
